assets.headline: We are back for Australia's second dig with the bat.

custom_metadata.asset: {"Over":"","Runs":"","Detail":"general","Isball":false,"Bowler":"","Batsman":"","Bowler_Name":"","Batsman_Name":"","Commentary":"We are back for Australia's second dig with the bat. Remember, they will only bat for an over. And the speculations were correct about Scott Boland coming out to open as the nightwatchman. He joins Travis Head as they both walk to the crease. Gus Atkinson has the new ball and is raring to go with Boland to face the first ball. Here we go...","Batsman_Details":{},"Non_Striker_Details":{},"Bowler_Details":{}}

assets.headline: While Australia stitched together four partnerships into double figures, England

custom_metadata.asset: {"Over":"","Runs":"","Detail":"innings_break","Isball":false,"Bowler":"","Batsman":"","Bowler_Name":"","Batsman_Name":"","Commentary":"While Australia stitched together four partnerships into double figures, England managed only two. The damage was done early by Mitchell Starc and Michael Neser, before Neser and the local favourite Scott Boland sliced through the middle order with surgical precision, sharing seven wickets between them. The pitch had its own demons and indentations, but consistently landing the ball in the right areas still demanded accuracy and control, qualities the Australian bowlers displayed in abundance. Back in a bit with Australia's second attempt with the bat.","Batsman_Details":{},"Non_Striker_Details":{},"Bowler_Details":{}}

assets.headline: Michael Neser is up for a quick chat with Isa Guha

custom_metadata.asset: {"Over":"","Runs":"","Detail":"innings_break","Isball":false,"Bowler":"","Batsman":"","Bowler_Name":"","Batsman_Name":"","Commentary":"Michael Neser is up for a quick chat with Isa Guha on the sidelines. He informs that Scott Boland sprinted off, but he doesn't know whether he would be opening the batting. Shares that batting has been tough and that the ball was nipping around, so it was about putting the ball in the right areas. Shares that playing on Boxing Day is a dream come true and gives him goosebumps. Feels that it is not easy out there with the ball moving, and it’s about finding the right balance between defence and attack with the bat.","Batsman_Details":{},"Non_Striker_Details":{},"Bowler_Details":{}}

assets.headline: Amid all the talk about the pitch, the batters’ technique

custom_metadata.asset: {"Over":"","Runs":"","Detail":"innings_break","Isball":false,"Bowler":"","Batsman":"","Bowler_Name":"","Batsman_Name":"","Commentary":"Amid all the talk about the pitch, the batters’ technique often gets overshadowed. Sure, it hasn’t been easy to bat on, but it wasn’t a wicket that justifies the scores of just 152 or 110 either. Being reduced to 8/3 with the top three blown away, England needed someone to play a calming influence, but Root, the most suitable one to do so, also couldn't carry forward, nicking one behind. At 16/4, it was Harry Brook who responded with a counterattack of 41 runs before perishing. After that, within the blink of an eye, 68/6 became 91/9, before a brief last wicket resistance from Gus Atkinson, who was the second highest scorer for England after Brook.","Batsman_Details":{},"Non_Striker_Details":{},"Bowler_Details":{}}

assets.headline: That's the 20th wicket of the day. If England were

custom_metadata.asset: {"Over":"","Runs":"","Detail":"innings_break","Isball":false,"Bowler":"","Batsman":"","Bowler_Name":"","Batsman_Name":"","Commentary":"That's the 20th wicket of the day. If England were excellent with the ball, Australia responded with even greater lethal intent. Jake Weatherald sprints off the field, so does Travis Head as Australia will come out to bat for one over before Stumps. It appears that Scott Boland has run off as well, and there is some chat happening between Cummins and Smith at the sidelines. It is now confirmed that Australia have opted for a heavy roller before they come out to bat.","Batsman_Details":{},"Non_Striker_Details":{},"Bowler_Details":{}}

assets.headline: 29.5 Cameron Green to Gus Atkinson,w,0 Run

custom_metadata.asset: {"BattingTeam_Id":"3","BowlingTeam_Id":"1","Over":"29.5","Iswicket":true,"Dismissed":"69416","Dismissed_Name":"Gus Atkinson","Runs":"0","Detail":"w","Isball":true,"Bowler":"66870","Batsman":"69416","Bowler_Name":"Cameron Green","Batsman_Name":"Gus Atkinson","Commentary":"OUT! CLEANED HIM UP! The change in length does the trick for Cameron Green. After four short balls in a row, Green pushes the ball up on the fuller side, on middle. Gus Atkinson backs away, expecting it to be a short ball. Ends up giving himself too much room and cannot make any connection. He is beaten on the outside edge and the ball crashes into the stumps. 28 (35) for Gus. England have been bowled out for 110 as Australia secure a 42-run lead.","OverNo":"30","BallNo":"5","Ball_Number":"179","This_Over":"0,0,0,0,0(W),","Batsman_Details":{"name":"Gus Atkinson","Runs":"28","Balls":"35","Fours":"3","Sixes":"1","id":"69416"},"Non_Striker_Details":{"name":"Josh Tongue","Runs":"1","Balls":"9","Fours":"0","Sixes":"0","id":"66292"},"Bowler_Details":{"name":"Cameron Green","Overs":"0.5","Maidens":"0","Runs":"0","Wickets":"1","Ball_bowled":"5","Dot_balls":"5","id":"66870"},"Ball_Speed":"141.8","Ball_Line_Length":"20,5,10,5,39,16","Dismissal_Type":"bowled","Dismissal_Id":"b"}

assets.headline: 29.2 Cameron Green to Gus Atkinson,0 Run
